page_analysis.text_content:
Accessory structures site planning

Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

A Combo garage /small pool cabana
(side by side)
• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the side lot line so
that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.

Interior lot example

Combo garage/
small poo house

Rear yard

B Stand-alone pool cabana

Note: Site planning for accessory buildings differs from that for parking structures in
one way. A special allowance enables garages to be located in the rear/side yards
even when the lot is not deep enough to maintain the 75' minimum distance from the
front lot line. This does not apply to non-parking accessory structures.

• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the rear lot line so
that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink,
toilet, and shower and is greater than 200
sf, so it requires a CUP.

Interior lot example

Rear
Larger pool cabana
yard

C Office above garage

• Structure is located within the buildable
area, so it doesn't have to comply with
regulations for structures in the required
yards and it may be two stories high.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.
• Structure is new 2nd floor addition and
therefore subject to the Planning
Department's Individual Review (IR).

Rear yard

above
garage

structure is 2
stories, it must be
located within the
buildable area
regardless of the
distances from the
lot lines and is
subject to Individual
Review (IR)

visual_elements.description: A site plan illustrating three different accessory structure scenarios on different lot types. Each scenario shows a main dwelling, an accessory structure, and various property lines and setbacks. The diagrams are labeled 'Interior lot example' (twice) and 'Corner lot example'.

Scenario A: 'Combo garage / small poo house' (likely 'pool house') on an interior lot. Shows a main dwelling, a combined garage/pool house in the rear yard, an interior-side yard with a 'Min. 75'' setback from the front lot line, and a front yard. The accessory structure is located right at the side lot line.

Scenario B: 'Larger pool cabana' on an interior lot. Shows a main dwelling, a 2-car attached garage, and a larger pool cabana in the rear yard. An interior-side yard with a 'Min. 75'' setback from the front lot line is indicated. The pool cabana is located right at the rear lot line.

Scenario C: 'Office above garage' on a corner lot. Shows a main dwelling, an office above a garage, and a street-side yard with a '3' min.' setback. The accessory structure is within the buildable area.
Legend for the site plan diagrams, defining line types and shaded areas.
visual_elements.location: Bottom right, next to the corner lot example

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from front lot line (Combo garage/small pool cabana)
Minimum distance from front lot line (Stand-alone pool cabana)
Minimum area for CUP (Stand-alone pool cabana)
Minimum setback (Street-side yard, Office above garage)

subheadings: A Combo garage /small pool cabana (side by side)
sections: Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

additional_notes: The text 'small poo house' in the first diagram's label is likely a typo and should be 'small pool house'.
The word 'ditters' in the initial 'Note' is likely a typo and should be 'differs'.
The word 'Indvidual' in section C is likely a typo and should be 'Individual'.
The word 'locted' in the 'Note' for the Corner lot example is likely a typo and should be 'located'.
cross_references: Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32 (referenced in sections A and B)
Planning Department's Individual Review (IR) (referenced in section C and the Corner lot example note)
